standards.description: Read and write six-digit numerals
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will read, write, and identify the place and value of each digit in a six-digit numeral, with and without models.

standards.description: Compare and order whole numbers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will compare and order whole numbers, each 9,999 or less.

standards.description: Represent fractions and mixed numbers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will name and write fractions and mixed numbers represented by a model.

standards.description: Estimate and determine sums and differences
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will estimate solutions to and solve single-step and multistep problems involving the sum or difference of two whole numbers, each 9,999 or less, with or without regrouping.

standards.description: Read, write, and identify place value to millions
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will read, write, and identify the place and value of each digit in a nine-digit whole number.

standards.description: Compare and order whole numbers to millions
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will compare and order whole numbers expressed through millions.

standards.description: Read, write, represent, and identify decimals
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will read, write, represent, and identify decimals expressed through thousandths.

standards.description: Compare and order fractions and mixed numbers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will compare and order fractions and mixed numbers, with and without models.

standards.description: Estimate and solve problems with whole numbers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will estimate and solve single-step and multistep addition, subtraction, and multiplication problems with whole numbers.

standards.description: Determine prime and composite numbers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will determine whether a whole number from 2 to 100 is prime or composite.

standards.description: Represent and identify equivalencies among fractions
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will represent and identify equivalencies among fractions and decimals, with and without models.

standards.description: Represent relationships between quantities using ratios
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will represent relationships between quantities using ratios, and will use appropriate notations, such as a/b, a to b, and a:b.

standards.description: Represent and determine equivalencies among fractions, mixed numbers, decimals, and percents
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will represent and determine equivalencies among fractions, mixed numbers, decimals, and percents.

standards.description: Identify and represent integers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will identify and represent integers; order and compare integers; and identify and describe absolute value of integers.

standards.description: Recognize and represent patterns with whole number exponents and perfect squares
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will recognize and represent patterns with whole number exponents and perfect squares.

standards.description: Investigate and describe the concept of positive exponents and perfect squares
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and describe the concept of positive exponents and perfect squares.

standards.description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide integers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will add, subtract, multiply, and divide integers.

standards.description: Investigate and describe the concept of negative exponents for powers of ten
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and describe the concept of negative exponents for powers of ten; compare and order numbers greater than zero written in scientific notation.

standards.description: Solve practical problems involving operations with rational numbers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will solve practical problems involving operations with rational numbers.

standards.description: Solve single-step and multistep problems using proportional reasoning
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will solve single-step and multistep practical problems, using proportional reasoning.

standards.description: Solve problems involving percent increase and decrease
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will solve single-step and multistep practical problems, using proportional reasoning: problems involving tips, tax, and percent increase and decrease.

standards.description: Compare and order real numbers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will compare and order real numbers.

standards.description: Describe the relationships between the subsets of the real number system
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will describe the relationships between the subsets of the real number system.

standards.description: Estimate and determine the two consecutive integers between which a square root lies
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will estimate and determine the two consecutive integers between which a square root lies.

standards.description: Solve practical problems involving consumer applications
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will solve practical problems involving consumer applications.

standards.description: Evaluate algebraic expressions
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will evaluate an algebraic expression for given replacement values of the variables.

standards.description: Solve multistep linear equations in one variable
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will solve multistep linear equations in one variable with the variable on one or both sides of the equation.

standards.description: Solve multistep linear inequalities in one variable
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will solve multistep linear inequalities in one variable with the variable on one or both sides of the inequality.

standards.description: Develop an understanding of scientific investigation
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations.

standards.description: Investigate and understand simple machines
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand that objects can be described by their physical properties. Key concepts include simple machines and their uses.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the water cycle
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand that ecosystems support a diversity of plants and animals that share limited resources. The water cycle is a key process.

standards.description: Demonstrate understanding of scientific investigation
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations.

standards.description: Investigate and understand electricity
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand the characteristics of electricity and its application in circuits.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the organization of the solar system
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand the organization of the solar system, including the sun, moon, Earth, and other planets.

standards.description: Plan and conduct investigations
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations.

standards.description: Investigate and understand matter and its properties
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand that matter is anything that has mass and takes up space. Key concepts include atoms and elements.

standards.description: Investigate and understand Earth's surface
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand how Earth's surface is constantly changing. Key concepts include weathering, erosion, and deposition.

standards.description: Demonstrate understanding of scientific reasoning
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations.

standards.description: Investigate and understand basic sources of energy
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand basic sources of energy, their origins, transformations, and uses.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the unique properties of water
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand the unique properties and characteristics of water and its roles in the natural and human-made environment.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the natural processes and human interactions that affect watershed systems
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand the natural processes and human interactions that affect watershed systems.

standards.description: Plan and conduct investigations
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations in which data are collected and recorded.

standards.description: Investigate and understand cellular organization
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand that all living things are composed of cells. Key concepts include cell structure and organelles.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the relationships among organisms in biological communities
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand the relationships among organisms in biological communities. Key concepts include producer, consumer, decomposer, predator, prey.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the Earth's history and geologic processes
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand that the Earth's crust undergoes change as a result of geologic processes.

standards.description: Plan and conduct investigations using the scientific method
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations using experimental design.

standards.description: Investigate and understand force, motion, and energy relationships
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand the relationships among force, motion, and energy. Key concepts include speed, velocity, and acceleration.

standards.description: Investigate and understand atoms and the periodic table
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand the organization of the periodic table. Key concepts include atomic structure, elements, and compounds.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the law of conservation of matter and energy
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand that the law of conservation of matter and energy applies to all transformations of matter and energy.

standards.description: Read and demonstrate comprehension of fictional texts
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read and demonstrate comprehension of fictional texts, including narratives and poetry.

standards.description: Read and demonstrate comprehension of nonfiction texts
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read and demonstrate comprehension of nonfiction texts.

standards.description: Write for a variety of purposes
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will write for a variety of purposes, including to describe, to inform, to entertain, and to explain.

standards.description: Expand vocabulary when reading
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will expand vocabulary when reading, using context clues, knowledge of roots, affixes, synonyms, and antonyms.

standards.description: Read and demonstrate comprehension of fictional texts
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read and demonstrate comprehension of fictional texts, including narratives and poetry, identifying the author's purpose, making inferences, and drawing conclusions.

standards.description: Write effectively in a variety of forms
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will write effectively in a variety of forms, including narrative, descriptive, opinion, and expository.

standards.description: Expand vocabulary when reading
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will expand vocabulary when reading, using knowledge of roots, affixes, synonyms, antonyms, and homophones.

standards.description: Read and demonstrate comprehension of fictional texts
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read and demonstrate comprehension of fictional texts, including narratives and poetry, identifying theme, point of view, and figurative language.

standards.description: Write for a variety of purposes
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will write for a variety of purposes: to describe, to inform, to entertain, to explain, and to persuade.

standards.description: Read and learn meanings of unfamiliar words
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read and learn the meanings of unfamiliar words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing word structure, and consulting reference materials.

standards.description: Read and demonstrate comprehension of fictional texts
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read and demonstrate comprehension of a variety of fictional texts, narrative nonfiction, and poetry, describing how the choice of language, setting, characters, and point of view contributes to the author's style.

standards.description: Read and demonstrate comprehension of nonfiction texts
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read and demonstrate comprehension of a variety of nonfiction texts, identifying main idea, supporting details, and organizational patterns.

standards.description: Write in a variety of forms
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will write in a variety of forms, including narrative, expository, persuasive, and reflective, with an emphasis on narrative and reflective writing.

standards.description: Read and learn meanings of unfamiliar words
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read to determine the meanings and pronunciations of unfamiliar words and phrases within authentic texts.

standards.description: Read and demonstrate comprehension of fictional texts
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read and demonstrate comprehension of a variety of fictional texts, narrative nonfiction, and poetry, comparing and contrasting various forms and genres.

standards.description: Write in a variety of forms
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will write in a variety of forms with an emphasis on exposition, persuasion, and narration.

standards.description: Apply knowledge of word origins and derivations
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will apply knowledge of word origins, derivations, and figurative language to extend vocabulary development in authentic texts.

standards.description: Read and demonstrate comprehension of fictional texts
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read and analyze a variety of fictional texts, narrative nonfiction, and poetry, making inferences and drawing conclusions based on explicit and implied information.

standards.description: Write in a variety of forms
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will write in a variety of forms, including narrative, expository, persuasive, and reflective.

standards.description: Represent verbal quantitative situations algebraically
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will represent verbal quantitative situations algebraically and evaluate these expressions for given replacement values of the variables.

standards.description: Perform operations on polynomials
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will perform operations on polynomials, including adding, subtracting, multiplying, dividing, and factoring.

standards.description: Solve multistep linear and quadratic equations
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will solve multistep linear and quadratic equations in two variables.

standards.description: Graph linear equations and linear inequalities in two variables
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will graph linear equations and linear inequalities in two variables.

standards.description: Investigate and analyze linear and quadratic function families
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and analyze linear and quadratic function families and their characteristics.

standards.description: Use deductive reasoning to construct and judge validity of a logical argument
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will construct and judge the validity of a logical argument consisting of a set of premises and a conclusion, using deductive reasoning.

standards.description: Solve problems involving symmetry and transformation
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student will solve problems involving symmetry and transformation, including translation, reflection, rotation, and dilation.

standards.description: Prove triangles congruent
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student, given information concerning the lengths of sides and/or measures of angles in triangles, will solve problems, including practical problems, and prove two triangles are congruent.

standards.description: Plan and conduct investigations using the scientific method
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the chemical and biochemical principles essential for life
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand the chemical and biochemical principles essential for life, including water chemistry, organic molecules, and the role of enzymes.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the relationships between cell structure and function
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand relationships between cell structure and function, including organelle function and cell division.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the mechanisms of heredity
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand the role of nucleic acids, DNA, and RNA, in the mechanisms of heredity, including the genetic code and protein synthesis.

standards.description: Investigate and understand the theory of biological evolution
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand bases for the modern classification of organisms, including evidence of evolution through comparative studies.

standards.description: Investigate and understand dynamic equilibria within populations, communities, and ecosystems
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student will investigate and understand dynamic equilibria within populations, communities, and ecosystems, including nutrient cycling, succession, and biodiversity.

standards.description: Apply knowledge of word origins, derivations, and figurative language
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will apply knowledge of word origins, derivations, and figurative language to extend vocabulary development in authentic texts.

standards.description: Read, comprehend, and analyze literary texts of different cultures and eras
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read, comprehend, and analyze literary texts of different cultures and eras, analyzing the development of themes across texts.

standards.description: Read, comprehend, and analyze literary texts
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read, comprehend, and analyze literary texts of different cultures and eras, comparing and contrasting literary elements across texts.

standards.description: Read and analyze American literature
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will read and analyze relationships among American literature, history, and culture.

standards.description: Write, revise, and edit in a variety of forms
standards.subject: English
standards.full_text: The student will write, revise, and edit personal, professional, and informational compositions, synthesizing information from multiple sources.
